safetyreport.nullificationreason: portions of previous reports were found to be erroneous and key data was missing. invalid information regarding the drug reaction. previously transmitted report should be considered completely void.

patient.patientmedicalhistorytext: patient has a history of diabetes, heart disease, and asthma. patient was hospitalized for insulin shock in 1994 for 2 weeks. despite doctor's warnings, patient continues to smoke and does not exercise regularly. a proper diet would help tremendously. patient has a history of mental illness in the family. patient was institutionalized for mild depression in 1990 for eight months. depression is being treated with prescription drugs. patient has never been hospitalized for severe asthma.
patient.resultstestsprocedures: blood glucose was 227 mg/dl and the glucose tolerance test was consistent with diabetes. Serum electrolytes indicated that the patient was not hyperosmotic. Urinalysis was 4+ glucose, 3+protein, with no RBC or WBC.

medicalhistoryepisode.patientmedicalcomment: patient's blood pressure medicine reacted adversely with asthma medicine, patient stopped breathing.
patient's blood pressure medicine reacted adversely with asthma medicine, patient stopped breathing.

patientpastdrugtherapy.patientdrugindication: suffered an asthma attack due to an allergic reaction to blood pressure medicine. breathing stopped.

parent.parentmedicalrelevanttext: parents have a history of asthma and heart disease. mother has been hospitalized numerous times for allergic reactions to medication. parents have a history of asthma and heart disease. mother has been hospitalized numerous times for allergic reactions to medication. parents have a history of asthma and heart disease. mother has been father died of heart failure at age 45. history.

parentmedicalhistoryepisode.parentmedicalcomment: patient's blood pressure medicine reacted adversely with asthma medicine, patient stopped breathing.
patient's blood pressure medicine reacted adversely with asthma medicine, patient stopped breathing.

parentpastdrugtherapy.parentdrugreaction: asthma attack, bronchial tubes constricted, cut off breathing. reacted with blood pressure medicine.

reaction.primarysourcereaction: allergic reaction between asthma medicine and blood pressure medicine. caused difficulty breathing.
allergic reaction between asthma medicine and blood pressure medicine. caused difficulty breathing.

test.testname: endochromagnopholis test phase 3, step 4343b. tests level of endoche.
endochromagnopholis test phase 3, step 4343b. tests level of endoche.

drug.medicinalproduct: witecaker's wittimandellicus seronome type n-4 for high blood pressure
drug.drugauthorizationholder: yutz and putz laboratories of maryland and northern virginia
drug.drugdosagetext: recommended dosage must be strictly followed. take medicine as prescribed, only on an empty stomach.12345678 micrograms 741 times every other day for a very long time.
drug.drugdosageform: drug dosage form is listed as 100000 mg caplettes.
drug.drugadditional: studies being performed to assess the effect of this new drug. in search of additional information.

activesubstance.activesubstancename: active ingredients include: hydrochorataine, water, and hypertacitus.

drugreactionrelatedness.drugassessmentsource: regulatory agency for the prevention of any needless deaths.

summary.reportercomment: more information is necessary to accurately assess this lethal drug combination (654321a). i recommend an in-depth investigation be conducted by the proper authorities (123). no further comments at this time.
